physDesc.p: This is a two page, typewritten transcription of letter originally in Amy Lowell's handwriting, sent by Monroe. It is titled with the words “Sevenels Brookline” at the top center of the page.

encodingDesc.p: This letter contains references to the following:

div.p: I am delighted with what you have done for me in the April number. Many thanks! Fletcher’s article is certainly most handsome, & I think my poems look very well- It is a good number. Rupert Brooke’s sonnets are high-minded, & serious, & thoroughly English. I think the dignity & sorrow of a real experience may make an excellent poet of him. Technique he always had, but he needed reality. Those little Padraic Column Poems, particularly the coal carts are very good. I think “The Orchestra” is one of Gibson’s best, & certainly “The Blackbird” is the best poem of Torrence’s I have seen

I am sending you a presentation copy of our Anthology. Of course you will get one in the ordinary course of business, but I want you to have one from me. In reviewing it, please don’t lay stress on the schism with Ezra. I don’t want to make the row important. Rows are a mistake, & their perpetuation shall be none of my doing- Do you know, my Dear, I have had occasion to go over all the numbers of Poetry since its beginning, in connection with a talk on “The New Manner in Modern Poetry” I gave at the “Round Table Club,” & I was immensely struck by the fact that
there is not a single poet of distinction among the younger generation whom you have not printed.

Go on, my Child, never mind any of us when we criticise, taken in its entirety your review is a magnificent achievement. And the impartiality with which you represent all schools is fine. Now I have a suggestion to make. You will remember that you still have six little poems of mine, & that you were going to lead off with me sometime. Now these six are not enough, either in size or importance to go alone. Will you take “Lead Soldiers” to preceed them? It is the best thing I have done, I am sure. You remember you liked it but I wanted to try “The New Republic” people with it. Of course it was way off from their taste, & the six gentlemen who vote upon the poetry there, turned it down. So it is at your disposal, & I suggest that you take it, & let it preceed the six poems you have, & open with the collection about August or September. Will you? If so I will send(sic) it right away.
Did I tell you that Masters wrote me a very nice letter, some time ago- I thought it was very kind of him to write, those things help
I am up to my eyes in work, for Macmillan has taken my french lectures, & they all have to be re-written, as they were done to speak.
Do take “Lead Soldiers”, it is good, I know
